intro: Eriosema, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false nettle, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. These plants are characterized by their hairy, glandular leaves and often have a distinctive, velvety texture. Eriosema species are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments. They produce small, clustered flowers that are often pink or white in color. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
